Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery open vessel, possibly a large bowl; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; exterior: slip worn; painted decoration consisting of part of large elaborate lotus-palmette; graffito lines on exterior, not clearly part of an inscription.
Curator's comments: Since the slip is worn, it is difficult to understand the painted decoration on the exterior surface.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2035) (phase 2)
